21 states take aim at
Mass. Medicare windfall

A Nantucket hospital’s rural designation has allowed the state’s 81 other hospitals to reap between a $256.6 million and $367 million annual bonus for the last two years.
Opinion | Christopher L. Gasper

Patriots have the coaching edge

Bill Belichick matching wits with Texans head coach Gary Kubiak is one of the biggest mismatches of the playoffs.

Menino at home away from home

The recuperating mayor has set up shop in the Parkman House, a mansion about as far from his Readville home as a man of the people can get.
Opinion | Joanna Weiss

Talk about gun safety, not control

Instead of pitting gun-control advocates directly against gun owners, a group of Boston doctors want to approach the issue as a problem of public health.

Having a devil of a time onscreen

What better antidote to winter than a series of movies that highlight the devil’s starpower? The repertory series Dead of Winter: Satan on Screen starts at the Brattle Friday.
Opinion | Joan Vennochi

A fair trial for ‘Whitey’ Bulger?

Judge Richard G. Stearns, who worked as a federal prosecutor in Boston while Bulger was roaming the streets, should not preside over his trial.
Opinion | Tom Keane

Pay more to go faster? Horrors!

The notion that people should pay for faster and more convenient transportation is commonplace.
